    ```
    git checkout -b temp            // 
    git push origin temp:temp       // pushtemp
    git push origin --delete main   // main
    git branch -d main              // main
    ```

3. ###### 

    ```
    git checkout -b main            // main
    git push origin main            // main
    git branch -d temp				// 
    git push origin --delete temp	// 
    ```

MALLOC(3)                BSD Library Functions Manual                MALLOC(3)

NAME
     calloc, free, malloc, realloc, reallocf, valloc, aligned_alloc -- memory allocation

SYNOPSIS
     #include <stdlib.h>

     void *
     calloc(size_t count, size_t size);

     void

        ...

DESCRIPTION
     The malloc(), calloc(), valloc(), realloc(), and reallocf() functions
     allocate memory.  The allocated memory is aligned such that it can be
     used for any data type, including AltiVec- and SSE-related types.  The
     aligned_alloc() function allocates memory with the requested alignment.
     The free() function frees allocations that were created via the preceding
     allocation functions.

    // 
    class Zhangsan {
        public void say() {
            System.out.println("");
        }

            System.out.println("");
        }
    }

    class Lisi {
        public void say() {
            System.out.println("");
        }
    
        public void get() {
            System.out.println("");
        }
    
    }
    
    public class ThreadDeadLock implements Runnable {
    
        private static Zhangsan zs = new Zhangsan();    // static
    
        private static Lisi ls = new Lisi();    // static
    
        private boolean flag = false; // 
    
        public void run() { // run()
            if (flag) {
                synchronized (zs) {  // 
                    zs.say();
                    try {
                        Thread.sleep(500);
                    } catch (InterruptedException e) {
                        e.printStackTrace();
                    }
                    synchronized (ls) {
                        zs.get();
                    }
                }
            } else {
                synchronized (ls) {
                    ls.say();
                    try {
                        Thread.sleep(500);
                    } catch (InterruptedException e) {
                        e.printStackTrace();
                    }
                    synchronized (zs) {
                        ls.get();
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    
        public static void main(String args[]) {
            ThreadDeadLock t1 = new ThreadDeadLock();   // 
            ThreadDeadLock t2 = new ThreadDeadLock();   // 
            t1.flag = true;
            t2.flag = false;
            Thread thA = new Thread(t1);
            Thread thB = new Thread(t2);
            thA.start();
            thB.start();
        }
    }
    //   
    ```
